intro: Miconia pseudocentrophora, commonly known as the Brazilian star-miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
